bibl.title: Translation [from Spanish] of a lease between [Ignacio Rojas?] and Antonio Sosa, September 24, 1899

div1.p: Sosa leases the San Jose farm.

div1.head: Translation [from Spanish] of a lease between [Ignacio Rojas?] and Antonio Sosa, September 24, 1899
div1.p:
? ? Sosa takes in lease the farm San Jose in Marianao at the
price of 600 pesos gold per year, paying one-half in advance, it being his
responsibility to repair and care for the fences and the house after they will
make the principal repairs to the house and the fences (copper wire) to divide
the farm in half, having besides in his care one or two cows. Today it was
delivered in the Fienda El Roble in the district of Quemados the $300.00
of the first payment that begins October 1, 1899 and that ends March 1, 1900.
In this form, $127.20 gold and $200.90 silver, that makes up the set sum of
300 pesos in gold.
